meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by an attraction to feces.
meanings.sent1: The coprophilous insects were drawn to the smell of feces.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the coprophilous behavior of certain animals.
meanings.sent3: The coprophilous dog seemed to find joy in rolling around in the mud.
meanings.sent4: Her coprophilous sense of humor always led to awkward situations.
meanings.sent5: The coprophilous nature of the swamp made it a unique ecosystem.

meanings.sent1: The coprophilous mushrooms thrived in the manure-rich soil.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often encounter coprophilous plants in their fields.
meanings.sent3: The coprophilous flowers added a touch of color to the compost pile.
meanings.sent4: The coprophilous vines intertwined with the dung, creating a peculiar sight.
meanings.sent5: The coprophilous bacteria played a crucial role in breaking down the waste.
